Detailed Description

This class is an abstract class that only does the basic set up of a curve.
Author:
Joachim Klahr
Version:
0.1
Date:
2006

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Spline::Curve::Curve (  ControlPoint *  controlPoints,
unsigned int  amount
) 
 

Creates all segments.

Parameters:
controlPoints Pointer to an array with all control points used to construct the curve.
amount The number of control points controlPoints are pointing at.

virtual Spline::Curve::~Curve (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes all segments.

Remarks:
Remember to delete[] your ControlPoints. The Curve will not do this for you.

Member Function Documentation

void Spline::Curve::calculateLength (  float  resolution  ) 
 

Calculates the total length of the curve.

Parameters:
resolution Higher value means smaller step size which increases the precision on the length of the curve.

float Spline::Curve::getLength (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
The total length of the curve.

References mLength.

virtual void Spline::Curve::getPositionOnSegment (  float *  position,
float  distance,
unsigned int  segment
)  [pure virtual]
 

Sets the position parameter to the world position on the specified segment. The distance parameter must be a value between 0 and 1.0.

Parameters:
position Is a float[3] where the elements represents a position coordinate.
distance The distance from the beginning of the curve.
segment Which segment to get the position from.

Implemented in Spline::Bezier, and Spline::Hermite.

void Spline::Curve::getTangent (  float *  tangent,
float  distance,
float  resolution = 0.001f
) 
 

Sets the tangent parameter to the normalized tangent on the curve.

Parameters:
tangent The normalized tangent
distance The distance in on the curve where to find the tangent.
resolution How far from the distance value the two points used to calculate the tangent, should be read. Smaller value means more precision, but not less performance.

virtual void Spline::Curve::getWorldPosition (  float *  position,
float  distance
)  [pure virtual]
 

Sets the position parameter to the world position distance units in on the curve.

Parameters:
position Is a float[3] where the elements represents a position coordinate.
distance The distance from the beginning of the curve.
Remarks:
If the distance parameter is greater the total length of the curve, position will be set to (0, 0, 0).

Implemented in Spline::Bezier, and Spline::Hermite.
